TopicTitle: [1.4.x] BDArmory Continued v1.2.2.2 [8/8/2018] + Vessel Mover, Camera Tools, BDMk22, Destruction Effects, Burn Together

51 minutes ago, Papa_Joe said:

- Add ability to move Vessel Mover main window. Git Issues #13 and #42

Finally, after a few years, we finally got this great feature of being able to move a window!  lol

8 hours ago, Temeter said:

That's a good trick, but I never really considered it because of the problem of acquiring ground targets with aircraft radar.

 

8 hours ago, Temeter said:

all radar are not equal and some are now much better for this than others

The only radar really suitable for this purpose in BDA is currently the AN/APG-63V1 radome.  That's the stubby nose one ,  with a ground clutter of 0.4 it should pick up landed aircraft sized targets from a decent altitude . While it could be better and really there should be at least one of each type , look down for spy planes , look up for fighters, and balanced  bit hacky general purpose ,    it should do the job

20 hours ago, War Eagle 1 said:

10 hours ago, XOC2008 said:

Since you're putting a mod up for download you should really make an official post including licensing information instead of piggybacking on the BDAc thread otherwise some users may think that it is A) part of the main BDAc mod, and B) officially 'sanctioned' by the BDAc team.

I’m planning on it. Just been busy

31 minutes ago, War Eagle 1 said:

I’m planning on it. Just been busy

Okay, sure, but the fact remains you’ve posted a link to a mod without relevant licensing information which tends to be a big deal around here, and you’re using the BDAc thread to do it. I’m not saying don’t post the mod, just that you should follow the rules everyone else has to follow.

28 minutes ago, XOC2008 said:

20 hours ago, Box of Stardust said:

Finally, after a few years, we finally got this great feature of being able to move a window!  lol

I won't argue , but would you rather I added a moving window or let BDA die?     Priorities are priorities...

40 minutes ago, War Eagle 1 said:

oh...my bad. sorry.
should i deleat the post then?

 

Your best bet is to create a thread, provide the link, make sure you have a proper license, and explain the mod in your thread.  We are totally not opposed to you talking about your mod (This is the whole point of BDA, it is an ecosystem), but @XOC2008 is correct.  the moderators will appreciate you following the mod rules.  it provides protection for you and for the other modders.  It also provides a place for you to get valuable feedback on your creation!

Edited March 27, 2018 by Papa_Joe

Is there a dipping sonar for helicopters?

Unless I'm blind, I feel like there aren't a lot of sonars in BDA or SM.
Do you guys know where did BDArmory obtain its 3d models? Making parts config is easy enough, but 3d models all cost money these days, did Bahamuto make them himself?

44 minutes ago, goduranus said:

did Bahamuto make them himself?

Yup I believe all the models were made by BD himself, a long time ago now,   some have been refreshed since but  are pretty much as intended on day one.  

99% of the part mod models on the forums are made by the mod makers themselves, we're not made of money either,  that's ignoring the fact that almost everything you can grab free , requires almost as much work to prep properly for KSP you may as well start from scratch anyway , and do it right.

On 3/28/2018 at 3:51 AM, byong614 said:

Is there a dipping sonar for helicopters?

Unless I'm blind, I feel like there aren't a lot of sonars in BDA or SM.

There is one dipping sonar in a as-of-yet-unavailable SM mod which he may or may not release as much of it is still in an extreme testing phase. As radar capabilities have grown, sonar needs some work to keep up, so if I'm not mistaken the only available sonars right now are the one in BDA, the similar looking one in SM Marine, and some of the bow sections on the SM subs.
